page.title: 16GHOSTS AND TALES OF WYKE 1.
page.content: There are many ghosts and tales that Wyke people tell. The most well known ghost is the headless horseman who rides around Judy Woods at night. The man had committed suicide in High Fernley House because the girl he loved had married his brother. High Fernley House was built in 1696 for William and Mary Richardson of Bierley Hall, whose initials W.R.M. can be found about the front door together with a sundial. The house is noted for its fine mullioned windows. Close by in High Fernley Farm, parchments containing a gypsy's curse were found in the beams of a barn. If they are removed, bad luck and misfortune is said to fall on the owners.
